SC.question: Define the term 'Code 4'
SC.answer: Request Wants and Warrants - Used to obtain a background check on a specific person or vehicle.
SC.ref: EXPLAIN CODES FOR RADIO COMMUNICATIONS - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 2 Para 2.9

SC.question: Define the term 'Code 9'
SC.answer: Switch Frequencies - Used to direct the switching of radio frequencies.
SC.ref: EXPLAIN CODES FOR RADIO COMMUNICATIONS - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 2 Para 2.9

SC.question: Define the term 'Code 12'
SC.answer: Duress - Refers to any duress situation.
SC.ref: EXPLAIN CODES FOR RADIO COMMUNICATIONS - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 2 Para 2.9

SC.question: Define the term 'Code 16'
SC.answer: Alarm Activation - Used to initiate an alarm activation.
SC.ref: EXPLAIN CODES FOR RADIO COMMUNICATIONS - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 2 Para 2.9

SC.question: Define an Active Duress
SC.answer: Active duress may be indicated by the use of electronic duress alarms to covertly advise another location/unit of a duress situation. Without alerting the person(s) causing the duress, that the alarm has been sounded. Other examples of active duress indicators include the passing of the wing duress word or failing to properly authenticate via the authentication code.
SC.ref: EXPLAIN DURESS PROCEDURES - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 2 Para 2.10

SC.question: Define a Passive Duress
SC.answer: Passive Duress. Passive duress is three consecutive failures to respond to your radio call sign.
SC.ref: EXPLAIN DURESS PROCEDURES - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 2 Para 2.10

SC.question: Where does the CCSFS BDOC duress alarm annunciate?
SC.answer: XY Facility
SC.ref: EXPLAIN DURESS PROCEDURES - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 2 Para 2.10

SC.question: Where does the PSFB ECC duress alarm annunciate?
SC.answer: PSFB Command Post
SC.ref: EXPLAIN DURESS PROCEDURES - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 2 Para 2.10

SC.question: What is the alternate channel used when notified of a Code 9?
SC.answer: A Net - Channel 3
SC.ref: EXPLAIN DURESS PROCEDURES - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 2 Para 2.10

SC.question: Under what jurisdiction does PSFB operate?
SC.answer: Exclusive
SC.ref: EXPLAIN LEGAL CONSIDERATIONS PROCEDURES - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 3 Para 3.1-Para 3.3

SC.question: Under what jurisdiction does CCSFS operate?
SC.answer: Exclusive and proprietary
SC.ref: EXPLAIN LEGAL CONSIDERATIONS PROCEDURES - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 3 Para 3.1-Para 3.3

SC.question: To what document would you refer to for specific jurisdictional boundaries.
SC.answer: SLD 45 Integrated Defense Plan 31-1
SC.ref: EXPLAIN LEGAL CONSIDERATIONS PROCEDURES - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 3 Para 3.1-Para 3.3

SC.question: Bomb Threat: Name three of five types of IED's commonly used.
SC.answer: Pyrotechnic, Electrical, Mechanical, Time Mechanism and Chemical
SC.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM BOMB THREAT/SUSPICIOUS PACKAGE PROCEDURES - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex H Appendix 6

SC.question: What form is utilized to assist in capturing vital information during a telephone bomb threat?
SC.answer: AF Form 440, Bomb Threat Aid
SC.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM BOMB THREAT/SUSPICIOUS PACKAGE PROCEDURES - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex H Appendix 6

SC.question: Bomb Threat: Ensure radio transmissions are not made within _______ (distance) of the affected area.
SC.answer: 50 feet
SC.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM BOMB THREAT/SUSPICIOUS PACKAGE PROCEDURES - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex H Appendix 6

SC.question: Bomb Threat: If a detonation time is given, do not search within ______ (time) before or after the detonation time.
SC.answer: 30 minutes
SC.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM BOMB THREAT/SUSPICIOUS PACKAGE PROCEDURES - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex H Appendix 6

SC.question: Bomb Threat: An initial evacuation distance of ____________ for items up to box size (large briefcase/package - 2 cubic ft.).
SC.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM BOMB THREAT/SUSPICIOUS PACKAGE PROCEDURES - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex H Appendix 6

SC.question: Bomb Threat: An initial evacuation distance of _______ for van or small truck.
SC.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM BOMB THREAT/SUSPICIOUS PACKAGE PROCEDURES - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex H Appendix 6

SC.question: Contaminated items generated by incidents involving blood-borne pathogens are disposed where?
SC.answer: Biohazard containers are located in the weapons cleaning areas of CCSFS and PSFB
SC.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM BLOODBOURNE PATHOGEN EXPOSURE CONTROL PRECEDURES - 45 SFS BBP Exposure Control Plan

SC.question: Active Shooter - Phase 5
SC.answer: Establish and preserve the crime scene
SC.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM ACTIVE SHOOTER RESPONSE - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 13 Para 13.1-Para 13.7.2

SC.question: Define the term 'Covered Wagon'
SC.answer: COVERED WAGON reports inform HHQ that an unusual incident affecting PL 1, 2, or 3 resources, probably or actually hostile, occurred at an installation or dispersed site.
SC.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM COVERED WAGON PROCEDURES - SFTRG 2v3 Chap 2. Security Reporting and Alerting System

SC.question: Whom may cancel a Covered Wagon report?
SC.answer: Installation Commander or designee may cancel the COVERED WAGON incident.
SC.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM COVERED WAGON PROCEDURES - SFTRG 2v3 Chap 2. Security Reporting and Alerting System

SC.question: The term ______ will be used when an individual deliberately drives past the IEC without being properly vetted.
SC.answer: gate runner
SC.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM TURN AROUND/GATE RUNNER PROCEDURES - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 9 Para 9.5-9.5.5.9

SC.question: The deployment of the Stinger Spike System must be authorized by whom?
SC.answer: Flight Sergeant
SC.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM TURN AROUND/GATE RUNNER PROCEDURES - 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3 Chap 9 Para 9.5-9.5.5.9

SC.question: Civil Disturbances - Describe PHASE ONE: Periods of Increased Tension.
SC.answer: The type of incidents which mark this phase may appear in the form of increased tension in living, dining and work areas.
SC.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM RESPONSE TO CIVIL DISTURBANCES - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex H Appendix 1

SC.question: Civil Disturbances - Describe PHASE FOUR: Full Riot Phase.
SC.answer: This phase is characterized by large-scale destruction of property, total defiance of authority, open mob activity, and breaches of peace which result in serious injury/death of innocent people.
SC.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM RESPONSE TO CIVIL DISTURBANCES - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex H Appendix 1

SC.question: Where is the primary Secure Hold area for explosive on CCSFS?
SC.answer: Within MSA #2
SC.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM DEPARTMENT OF ENERGY SAFE HAVEN PROCEDURES - 45 SWI 24-602-O Chap 5.1 Para 5.1.1-5.5.4

SC.question: DoD Installations must provide Safe Haven for AA&E shipments during emergency conditions. What areas are designated for Safe Haven at PSFB and CCSFS?
SC.answer: PSFB - Hot Cargo Pad (HCP) #1 & CCSFS - MSA #2
SC.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM DEPARTMENT OF ENERGY SAFE HAVEN PROCEDURES - 45 SWI 24-602-O Chap 5.1 Para 5.1.1-5.5.4

SC.question: Where should the Access Control Point (ACP) be established along the cordon of a hazardous incident?
SC.answer: The ACP is established upwind or crosswind of the incident site and at the established evacuation distance.
SC.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM ALARM RESPONSE - SFTRG 2v4 Chap 4. Chap 5. Chap 6.

SC.question: Who will assume initial IC (incident Command) for law and order and security related responses.
SC.answer: The Senior SF Member
SC.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM ALARM RESPONSE - SFTRG 2v4 Chap 4. Chap 5. Chap 6.

SC.question: Who determines the size of an initial cordon?
SC.answer: Incident Commander
SC.ref: EXPLAIN/PERFORM ALARM RESPONSE - SFTRG 2v4 Chap 4. Chap 5. Chap 6.

SC.question: Define the CCSFS North Sector
SC.answer: From Traffic Control Point (TCP) 25N to the east on Phillips Parkway through Complex 34 to the beach, north along the beach to the north boundary, west to incorporate the entire ITL area, the entire Complex 41 area and support buildings, south along ITL road back to TCP 25 N and all areas in between.
SC.ref: EXPLAIN SECURITY FORCE INSTALLATION PATROLLING AND SECTOR PRIORITIZATION - 45 SW IDP 31-1 Annex C Appendix 3
